title: The subtle war in northern Israel, a crucible for escalating tensions with Iran
summary: Since October 7, 2023, Israel has stepped up its strikes in Lebanon and Syria, targeting Iran and its allies.

title: Jury sworn in for Trump's criminal trial
summary: On Thursday, a 12-person jury was selected for the former US president's historic hush money trial, moving the case closer to opening statements and the beginning of several weeks of dramatic testimony.

title: Enrico Letta: Europe's economy is falling behind, 'we can't wait any longer'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde, the former Italian prime minister suggests using European savings to finance the green and digital transition, pooling 10% of state aid and launching a new recovery plan to help the European economy catch up with the US.

title: Brazil: Lula is struggling to reduce the population's debt
summary: Launched in July 2023, the 'Desenrola' program, aimed at renegotiating the unpaid debts of over 70 million people, remains far from achieving its objectives.

title: United States vetoes Palestinian bid for UN membership
summary: The vote in the 15-member Security Council was 12 in favor, the United States opposed and two abstentions, from the United Kingdom and Switzerland. France, Japan and South Korea supported the resolution.

title: 'Evil Does Not Exist,' a sublime western in the Japanese wilderness
summary: Filmmaker and screenwriter Ryusuke Hamaguchi beautifully captures the threat of collapse in a pristine village near Tokyo. His work is a true masterpiece.

title: Europa League: Marseille beat Benfica in penalties to reach semi-finals
summary: Meanwhile, Liverpool exited the tournament despite a 1-0 victory over Atalanta, who advanced to face Marseille in the semi-finals. Bayer Leverkusen secured their semi-final spot with a 1-1 draw at West Ham, and Roma triumphed over AC Milan.

title: The balancing act of the Gulf States in the face-off between Israel and Iran
summary: During Iran's offensive, Saudi Arabia and EAU reportedly allowed Washington, London and Paris to use their bases in the region on condition that no projectiles were intercepted from their territory.

title: Ukrainian authorities are worried about online disinformation
summary: The Telegram app, which has become invaluable for staying updated on the war, is also being used by Russia to fuel the anxieties and divisions in Ukrainian society.

title: Kenya military helicopter crash kills defense chief and senior officers
summary: Defense forces chief General Francis Omondi Ogolla was among those killed in a helicopter crash about 400 kilometers northwest of Nairobi.

title: Police arrest dozens of pro-Palestinian protestors at Columbia University
summary: The students had set up a pro-Palestinian encampment, demanding that the school divest from companies they allege profit from Israeli apartheid and military actions in Gaza.

title: Google fires 28 workers protesting contract with Israel
summary: Google has terminated 28 employees involved in a protest over Google's provision of cloud services to the government of Israel.

title: Two schoolgirls wounded in knife attack near Strasbourg
summary: Two girls aged six and 11 have been wounded in a knife attack outside their school and are being treated in hospital. The attacker has been arrested.

title: European leaders call for more sanctions against Iran
summary: The EU's 27 heads of state and government, meeting in Brussels on Wednesday evening, aimed to expand their retaliatory measures against the regime in Tehran, while avoiding any escalation in the Middle East.

title: Iran's attack against Israel shows Revolutionary Guards are toughening their stance
summary: Since former US president Donald Trump's unilateral exit from the nuclear deal in 2018, the regime's ideological army has dictated the Islamic Republic's foreign policy.

title: French PM announces crackdown on teen school violence
summary: Prime Minister Gabriel Attal has presented measures for a 'surge of authority' after a series of attacks on schoolchildren by their peers.

title: Firefighters battle Copenhagen blaze for third day as stock exchange facade collapses
summary: Copenhagen police have launched a major investigation to determine the cause of the fire that has burned for three days, destroying the historic 17th-century Borsen building.

title: Mélenchon hits back at anti-Semitism accusations, after conference canceled: 'They know they're lying'
summary: The Palestinian question took up a large part at Mélenchon's La France Insoumise party's European election rally in northern France, after the controversy sparked when a debate at Lille University was canceled.

title: Sylvain Amic appointed president of the Musée d'Orsay
summary: The 56-year-old new head of the Parisian institution dedicated to the 19th century succeeds Christophe Leribault, who was appointed head of the Château de Versailles at the end of February.

title: Algeria's first KFC experiences a hectic opening
summary: On the day of the inauguration, pro-Palestinian activists gathered outside the restaurant to call for a boycott of the American brand, accused of supporting Israel.

title: Iran activates its air defense, US media reports Israeli strike
summary: Iran said Friday it shot down several drones and that there had been "no missile attack for now." ABC, citing a senior US official, reported that Israel has launched an attack against Iran in retaliation for last weekend's strikes on its territory.

title: Le Pen's RN has consistently backed authoritarian regimes in European Parliament votes
summary: An analysis of votes cast by Rassemblement National MEPs over the 2019-2024 term reveals how the far-right party views international relations. It has paid little heed to the defense of human rights.

title: French judoka Clarisse Agbégnénou: 'I want to say to myself, like before, I know I'm going to win'
summary: With just over three months before the Games, the judoka is looking to regain 'a sense of invincibility,' having dominated the sport over the last decade. She is aiming for a third Olympic title in Paris.
